description: Amman, the capital of Jordan, experiences a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters. As one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, Amman offers a fascinating blend of ancient history and modern development. From the ancient Citadel to the modern Abdali district, from traditional souks to contemporary art galleries, Amman provides visitors with a rich cultural experience. The city's strategic location makes it an ideal base for exploring Jordan's many historical and natural wonders.
